name: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine
Reason: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine has a melting point that we can compare to naphthalene, which has a melting point of 95 degrees Celsius. The basic unit we can compare to is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which could each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The methoxybenzoyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10; (3) The naphthoyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20; (4) The hydrazono-thiadiazole conjugated system introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
